meanings.definition: The system of government in a church where each congregation is independent and self-governing.
meanings.sent1: In congregationalisms, each church makes its own decisions.
meanings.sent2: The history of congregationalisms dates back many centuries.
meanings.sent3: When the two congregationalisms argued over the color of the new carpet, it became a colorful debate.
meanings.sent4: The beauty of congregationalisms lies in the diversity of church practices.
meanings.sent5: The essence of congregationalisms is the freedom of each congregation to govern itself.

meanings.definition: The beliefs and practices of a congregational church.
meanings.sent1: She studied the congregationalisms of different churches for her thesis.
meanings.sent2: The congregationalisms of that church emphasize community involvement.
meanings.sent3: The congregationalisms of the church included a weekly potluck dinner.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to the congregationalisms of his faith was unwavering.
meanings.sent5: The congregationalisms of their church were welcoming and inclusive.
